Khir Ganga is a temporary village set up through out the summers in Himichal Pradesh. It is only accessible by foot. It is a beautiful day hike on a narrow cliff side path going by numerous waterfalls and few isolated villages. There is usually about 30-50 people at the village site during the high season.
From Manikaran take a taxi to Bersani
Foot, donkey, or horse. No vehicles are able to make it to this spot
2 to 4 hour hike depending on pace to the hill station

Sit in a natural hot spring and enjoy the dramatic scenery of the valley.

Visit the small temple by the hot spring.
Rooms are available without booking in advance and run about 200 rupees a night.
